course_title: Career Guidance: Counselling for Life Planning

learning_outcomes.description: Understand the theory informing career development work
Apply career development theory to your own career development and that of others including diverse groups
Develop and implement client appropriate interventions such as career education, career programs, career counselling, and career assessment
Articulate a personal practice framework for career development work
Demonstrate ethical practice and professional conduct in career development work

assessments.task_description:
1. Reflect on your own career development. Represent your career development on a timeline that includes all of the roles and occupations you have ever wanted to be, have been, are and still want to be, and the significant influences on your career development such as people, events, literature or media.
  2. Analyse your career development from the perspective of at least three career development theories. Compare and contrast the relevance of these theories to your career development. You could choose from various career theories including: Super, Holland, Krumboltz, Savickas, and Gottfredson or Social Cognitive Career Theory, Cognitive Information Processing Theory or the Systems Theory Framework of career development (or others not listed, if desired).
  3. Describe the implications of your reflection for your work with clients.
  4. Your reference list should contain at least 20 references including books, book chapters and journal articles.

(NB: Your work will be treated confidentially, and you are not expected to discuss aspects of your life which you are not comfortable sharing with another person. It is the analysis of your career development rather than its content that will be evaluated.)

A marking rubric is available on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Develop a discussion paper for a school or organisation that provides a rationale for the development and provision of a career development service for a particular student/client/employee population. Examples of such a service include career development programs or career counselling, underpinned by career theory.

  1. Describe the context of your organisation and the intended recipients of your service (i.e., students, clients, employees).
  2. Explain the career development needs of your intended recipients and describe evidence of those needs. Use relevant literature and career theory to support your explanation of the intended recipients' career development needs.
  3. Develop a rationale for the provision of a career development service for the recipients you have identified.
  4. In your paper, describe the benefits and challenges of the development and provision of your proposed career development service for the recipients and also other students/staff/administration/management.
  5. Use significant Australian and international literature, career theory, reports and policy to support your paper. Your reference list should contain at least 20 references including books, book chapters and journal articles.

A marking rubric is available on the course Blackboard site.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.
